Description: Fragment of coarse stone bearing incised Greek text.
Curator's comments: The text has Doric elements, at least in -damou. Petrie reports the western part of the Great Temenos as the findspot: " Within the uncultivated area of the temenos I sank many pits down to water-level, but never found anything but a block of basalt. Close to the surface, in some Roman buildings west of the great chambers [the casemate building], was found a fragment of marble inscription, mentioning a temenos (pl. xxxi. 9), but it might have been brought as building material in Roman times." See also Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 154
Bibliographic references: Inscription / The Collection of Ancient Greek Inscriptions in the British Museum (1093)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (no. 22, pl. 39, 3-4.)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 34, pl. xxxi.9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (BA.24)
